It sounds like you had a really strong bond with this teacher and I hate that we can automatically assume the worst... but Iâ€™m glad you found help at some point from her and Iâ€™m sorry youâ€™ve lost that connection. All I can say is I hope you find new ways to cope and that an educatorâ€™s job is to support their students sustainably â€” theres a tipping point for everyone, including them, and itâ€™s not necessarily your fault. Maybe she had other issues going on and canâ€™t handle providing that extra support. Who knows. Either way I hope you get through this ğŸ¤

Also side note: teachers are required by law (at least in California) to report any dangers they might see among their students. Of course what you talk about will be confidential but I sincerely hope your teacher has your best interests in mind when considering this. She might be pushing you to talk to a therapist instead because she may not want to overstep. If you are in serious harm to yourself please reach out to a hotline or even to her again, and id really hope she does the right thing.
